direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods deal with text content within elements, but 'text()' retrieves the combined text while 'hasText()' checks for the presence of non-blank text.
Both methods process text content within elements, but 'eachText()' collects text from each element while 'hasText()' checks for the presence of text.
Both methods access and process HTML content, but 'html()' retrieves the inner HTML while 'hasText()' checks for text content.
Both methods access and process HTML content, but 'outerHtml()' retrieves the outer HTML while 'hasText()' checks for text content.
Both methods involve processing elements based on certain criteria, but 'select(String)' filters elements based on a query while 'hasText()' checks for text content.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements with text content is necessary before checking for text presence.
Retrieving text content can be used to verify the state before checking for text presence.
Collecting text content can be used to verify the presence of text after the check.
